billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO CULTURAL AFFAIRS, TOURISM, PARKS AND RECREATION

title: Establishes protocols for combative sports; authorizes mixed martial arts events in this state
summary: Establishes protocols for combative sports; authorizes mixed martial arts events in this state; establishes procedures for applications for licenses; establishes penalties for violations; imposes taxes on gross receipts of such events.
currentCommittee: CULTURAL AFFAIRS, TOURISM, PARKS AND RECREATION

       AN ACT to amend chapter 912 of the laws of 1920 relating  to  the  regu-
         lation  of boxing, sparring and wrestling, in relation to establishing
         protocols for combative sports  and  authorizing  mixed  martial  arts
         events in this state; to amend the tax law, in relation to the imposi-
         tion  of a tax on the gross receipts of any person holding any profes-
         sional or amateur boxing, sparring or wrestling match  or  exhibition,
         or  professional  combative  sports match or exhibition; and providing
         for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-

   25    S 2. Section 5-a of chapter 912 of the laws of 1920  relating  to  the
   26  regulation  of boxing, sparring and wrestling, as added by chapter 14 of

   28    S 5-a. Combative sports. 1. DEFINITIONS. AS USED IN THIS SECTION:
   29    (A) "BOARD" MEANS MEDICAL ADVISORY BOARD  AS  ESTABLISHED  IN  SECTION
   30  FOUR OF THIS ACT.
   31    (B)  A  "combative sport" shall mean any professional match or exhibi-
   32  tion other than boxing, sparring, wrestling or martial arts wherein  the
   33  contestants deliver, or are not forbidden by the applicable rules there-
   34  of from delivering kicks, punches or blows of any kind to the body of an
   35  opponent  or  opponents.  For  the  purposes  of  this section, the term
   36  "martial arts" shall include any professional match or exhibition  OF  A
   37  SINGLE  DISCIPLINE sanctioned by AN ORGANIZATION APPROVED BY THE COMMIS-
   38  SION, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, any of the following organizations:
   39  U.S. Judo Association, U.S. Judo, Inc., U.S. Judo Federation,  U.S.  Tae
   40  Kwon  Do  Union,  North American Sport Karate Association, U.S.A. Karate
   41  Foundation, U.S. Karate, Inc., World  Karate  Association,  Professional
   42  Karate  Association,  Karate  International, International Kenpo Associ-
   43  ation, or World Wide Kenpo Association. The  commission  [is  authorized
   44  to]  SHALL  promulgate  regulations  which  would establish a process to
   45  allow for the inclusion or removal of martial  arts  organizations  from
   46  the above list. Such process shall include but not be limited to consid-
   47  eration  of  the  following  factors:    [(a)] (1) is the organization's
   48  primary purpose to provide instruction in self defense techniques; [(b)]
   49  (2) does the organization require  the  use  of  hand,  feet  and  groin
   50  protection during any competition or bout; and [(c)] (3) does the organ-
   51  ization  have  an  established  set  of rules that require the immediate
   52  termination of any competition or bout when any participant has received
   53  severe punishment or is in danger of suffering serious physical injury.
   54    (C) "COMMISSION" MEANS THE STATE ATHLETIC COMMISSION AS  PROVIDED  FOR
   55  IN  SECTION  ONE OF THIS CHAPTER OR AN AGENT OF THE COMMISSION ACTING ON
   56  ITS BEHALF.

       S. 1707                             3

    1    (D) "MIXED MARTIAL  ARTS"  MEANS  ANY  PROFESSIONAL  COMBATIVE  SPORTS
    2  COMPETITION  WHEREIN THE RULES OF SUCH COMPETITION SUBJECT TO THE APPLI-
    3  CABLE LIMITATIONS AS SET FORTH BY THE COMMISSION AUTHORIZE  PROFESSIONAL
    4  COMBATIVE  SPORTS MATCHES OR EXHIBITIONS BETWEEN VARIOUS FIGHTING DISCI-
    5  PLINES,  INCLUDING THE UTILIZATION OF PERMITTED MARTIAL ARTS TECHNIQUES,
    6  INCLUDING  STRIKING,  KICKING  AND  GRAPPLING.  NO  NON-PROFESSIONAL  OR
    7  AMATEUR  BOUT,  EXHIBITION  OR  PARTICIPANT  SHALL BE AUTHORIZED BY THIS
    8  SECTION.
    9    (E) "PROFESSIONAL COMBATIVE SPORTS PARTICIPANT" OR "PARTICIPANT" SHALL
   10  MEAN A COMBATIVE SPORTS FIGHTER WHO COMPETES FOR A MONEY PRIZE OR TEACH-
   11  ES OR PURSUES OR ASSISTS IN THE PRACTICE OF  MIXED  MARTIAL  ARTS  AS  A
   12  MEANS  OF  OBTAINING  A  LIVELIHOOD  OR  PECUNIARY GAIN, AND ANY CONTEST
   13  CONFORMING TO THE RULES, REGULATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS OF THIS SECTION.
   14    (F) "PROFESSIONAL COMBATIVE SPORTS MATCH OR EXHIBITION" SHALL MEAN ANY
   15  MATCH OR EXHIBITION THAT  MUST  BE  APPROVED  BY  THE  COMMISSION  WHERE
   16  PROFESSIONAL  COMBATIVE SPORTS PARTICIPANTS RECEIVE CONSIDERATION OF ANY
   17  VALUE OR AN ADMISSION IS CHARGED.
   18    1-A. COMMISSION REVIEW. THE COMMISSION SHALL REVIEW EACH MARTIAL  ARTS
   19  SANCTIONING  ORGANIZATION,  INCLUDING THOSE LISTED IN SUBDIVISION ONE OF
   20  THIS SECTION, AT LEAST BIENNIALLY, OR  SOONER  IF  DETERMINED  NECESSARY
   21  BASED  UPON  THE PERIODIC COMPLIANCE CHECKS OR COMPLAINTS TO THE COMMIS-
   22  SION, TO  DETERMINE  CONTINUATION  OF  THE  COMMISSION'S  APPROVAL.  THE
   23  COMMISSION  SHALL  CONTINUE APPROVAL OR SHALL SUSPEND OR REVOKE APPROVAL
   24  BASED UPON COMPLIANCE OF THE ORGANIZATION WITH THE APPROVED  SANCTIONING
   25  STANDARDS  AND  ITS  ABILITY  TO  SUPERVISE  MATCHES IN THE STATE.   THE
   26  COMMISSION SHALL ACT UPON ANY APPLICATION FOR INCLUSION IN THE  LIST  IN
   27  PARAGRAPH  (B)  OF  SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION WITHIN SIXTY DAYS OF
   28  THE DATE SUCH APPLICATION IS MADE TO THE COMMISSION.
   29    1-B. MIXED MARTIAL ARTS COMPETITION. THE COMMISSION  SHALL  PROMULGATE
   30  RULES AND REGULATIONS TO ALLOW FOR MIXED MARTIAL ARTS COMPETITIONS TO BE
   31  CONDUCTED,  HELD,  OR GIVEN WITHIN THE STATE OF NEW YORK AND SHALL ALLOW
   32  FOR LICENSES TO BE APPROVED BY THE COMMISSION FOR SUCH MATCHES OR  EXHI-
   33  BITIONS.  THE  COMMISSION  IS  AUTHORIZED  TO PROMULGATE RULES AND REGU-
   34  LATIONS TO CARRY OUT THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SUBDIVISION. SUCH RULES  AND
   35  REGULATIONS  SHALL  INCLUDE,  BUT  NOT  BE  LIMITED  TO, THE ADOPTION OF
   36  UNIFIED RULES OF MIXED MARTIAL ARTS, A LICENSING PROCESS FOR MATCHES AND
   37  EXHIBITIONS, A FEE SCHEDULE FOR SUCH LICENSES, PROCEDURES TO  ALLOW  FOR
   38  THE PARTICIPATION, PROMOTION, AND ADVANCEMENT OF SUCH EVENTS, THE HEALTH
   39  AND SAFETY OF PARTICIPANTS, AND THE BEST INTERESTS OF MIXED MARTIAL ARTS
   40  AND  THE  ADOPTION OF RULES AND REGULATIONS FOR LICENSING AND REGULATION
   41  OF ANY AND ALL GYMS, CLUBS, TRAINING CAMPS AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONS  THAT
   42  MAINTAIN  TRAINING FACILITIES PROVIDING CONTACT SPARRING FOR PERSONS WHO
   43  PREPARE FOR PARTICIPATION IN SUCH PROFESSIONAL COMBATIVE SPORTS OR EXHI-
   44  BITIONS, EXCEPT AS OTHERWISE PROVIDED IN THIS SECTION.
   45    (B) THE COMMISSION IS AUTHORIZED AND  DIRECTED  TO  REQUIRE  THAT  ALL
   46  SITES  WHEREIN  PROFESSIONAL COMBATIVE SPORTS ARE CONDUCTED SHALL COMPLY
   47  WITH STATE AND APPLICABLE LOCAL SANITARY  CODES  APPROPRIATE  TO  SCHOOL
   48  ATHLETIC FACILITIES.
   49    2.  [No  combative  sport shall be conducted, held or given within the
   50  state of New York, and no licenses may be approved by the commission for
   51  such matches or exhibitions.
   52    3. (a) A person who knowingly advances or  profits  from  a  combative
   53  sport  activity  shall  be guilty of a class A misdemeanor, and shall be
   54  guilty of a class E felony if he or she has been convicted in the previ-
   55  ous five years of violating this subdivision.

       S. 1707                             4

    1    (b) A person advances a combative sport activity  when,  acting  other
    2  than  as a spectator, he or she engages in conduct which materially aids
    3  any combative sport. Such conduct includes but is not limited to conduct
    4  directed toward the creation, establishment or performance of  a  comba-
    5  tive sport, toward the acquisition or maintenance of premises, parapher-
    6  nalia,  equipment  or  apparatus  therefor,  toward  the solicitation or
    7  inducement of persons to attend or participate therein, toward the actu-
    8  al conduct of the performance thereof, toward the arrangement of any  of
    9  its  financial  or  promotional  phases,  or toward any other phase of a
   10  combative sport. One advances a combative sport  activity  when,  having
   11  substantial  proprietary  or  other  authoritative control over premises
   12  being used with his or her knowledge for purposes of a  combative  sport
   13  activity, he or she permits such to occur or continue or makes no effort
   14  to prevent its occurrence or continuation.
   15    (c)  A  person  profits from a combative sport activity when he or she
   16  accepts or receives money or other property with intent  to  participate
   17  in  the proceeds of a combative sport activity, or pursuant to an agree-
   18  ment or understanding with any person whereby he or she participates  or
   19  is to participate in the proceeds of a combative sport activity.
   20    (d)  Any  person  who  knowingly  advances or profits from a combative
   21  sport activity shall also be subject to a civil penalty  not  to  exceed
   22  for the first violation ten thousand dollars or twice the amount of gain
   23  derived  therefrom  whichever  is greater, or for a subsequent violation
   24  twenty thousand dollars or twice the amount of  gain  derived  therefrom
   25  whichever  is  greater.  The  attorney  general  is  hereby empowered to
   26  commence judicial proceedings to recover such penalties  and  to  obtain
   27  injunctive  relief  to  enforce the provisions of this section.] PROFES-
   28  SIONAL COMBATIVE SPORTS MATCHES AND EXHIBITIONS AUTHORIZED. NO COMBATIVE
   29  SPORTS MATCH OR EXHIBITION SHALL BE CONDUCTED, HELD OR GIVEN WITHIN  THE
   30  STATE  EXCEPT  IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION AND THE
   31  RULES AND REGULATIONS PROMULGATED BY THE  COMMISSION  PURSUANT  THERETO.
   32  THE COMMISSION SHALL DIRECT A REPRESENTATIVE TO BE PRESENT AT EACH PLACE
   33  WHERE COMBATIVE SPORTS ARE TO BE HELD PURSUANT TO THE PROVISIONS OF THIS
   34  SECTION.  SUCH  REPRESENTATIVE  SHALL  ASCERTAIN  THE  EXACT  CONDITIONS
   35  SURROUNDING SUCH MATCH OR EXHIBITION AND MAKE A WRITTEN  REPORT  OF  THE
   36  SAME IN THE MANNER AND FORM PRESCRIBED BY THE COMMISSION. SUCH COMBATIVE
   37  SPORTS  MATCHES OR EXHIBITIONS MAY BE HELD IN ANY BUILDING FOR WHICH THE
   38  COMMISSION IN ITS DISCRETION MAY ISSUE A LICENSE. WHERE  SUCH  MATCH  OR
   39  EXHIBITION IS AUTHORIZED TO BE HELD IN A STATE OR CITY OWNED ARMORY, THE
   40  PROVISION  OF THE MILITARY LAW IN RESPECT THERETO MUST BE COMPLIED WITH,
   41  BUT NO SUCH MATCH OR EXHIBITION SHALL BE HELD IN A BUILDING WHOLLY  USED
   42  FOR RELIGIOUS SERVICES.
   43    3. JURISDICTION OF COMMISSION. (A) THE COMMISSION SHALL HAVE AND HERE-
   44  BY  IS VESTED WITH THE SOLE DIRECTION, MANAGEMENT, CONTROL AND JURISDIC-
   45  TION OVER ALL PROFESSIONAL COMBATIVE SPORTS MATCHES OR EXHIBITIONS TO BE
   46  CONDUCTED, HELD OR GIVEN WITHIN THE STATE  OF  NEW  YORK  AND  OVER  ALL

   49  AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONS  THAT  MAINTAIN  TRAINING  FACILITIES  PROVIDING
   50  CONTACT  SPARRING  FOR  PERSONS  WHO  PREPARE  FOR PARTICIPATION IN SUCH
   51  PROFESSIONAL  COMBATIVE  SPORTS  OR  EXHIBITIONS,  EXCEPT  AS  OTHERWISE

   53    (B)  THE  COMMISSION  IS  AUTHORIZED  AND DIRECTED TO REQUIRE THAT ALL
   54  SITES WHEREIN PROFESSIONAL COMBATIVE SPORTS ARE CONDUCTED  SHALL  COMPLY
   55  WITH  STATE  AND  APPLICABLE  LOCAL SANITARY CODES APPROPRIATE TO SCHOOL
   56  ATHLETIC FACILITIES.

    1    4. ENTITIES  REQUIRED  TO  PROCURE  LICENSES;  PROFESSIONAL  COMBATIVE
    2  SPORTS PARTICIPANTS DEFINED. EXCEPT AS OTHERWISE PROVIDED IN SUBDIVISION
    3  SIX OF THIS SECTION, ALL CORPORATIONS, PERSONS, LIMITED LIABILITY COMPA-
    4  NIES,  REFEREES,  JUDGES, CORPORATION TREASURERS, PROFESSIONAL COMBATIVE

   10  SION.  THE  COMMISSION  SHALL ESTABLISH BY RULE AND REGULATION LICENSING
   11  STANDARDS FOR REFEREES, JUDGES, MANAGERS, PROMOTERS, TRAINERS AND  CHIEF
   12  SECONDS.    ANY MATCH OR EXHIBITION CONFORMING TO THE RULES, REGULATIONS
   13  AND REQUIREMENTS OF THIS SECTION SHALL BE DEEMED TO  BE  A  PROFESSIONAL
   14  COMBATIVE SPORTS MATCH OR EXHIBITION.
   15    5.  LICENSE  TO  ENTITIES.  (A) THE COMMISSION MAY, IN ITS DISCRETION,
   16  ISSUE A LICENSE TO CONDUCT OR HOLD PROFESSIONAL COMBATIVE SPORTS MATCHES
   17  OR EXHIBITIONS, SUBJECT TO THE PROVISIONS HEREOF, TO ANY PERSON,  CORPO-
   18  RATION OR LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY DULY INCORPORATED OR FORMED, HEREIN-
   19  AFTER REFERRED TO AS "ENTITY".
   20    (B) A PROSPECTIVE LICENSEE MUST SUBMIT TO THE COMMISSION PROOF THAT IT
   21  CAN FURNISH SUITABLE PREMISES IN WHICH SUCH MATCH OR EXHIBITION IS TO BE
   22  HELD.
   23    (C)  UPON WRITTEN APPLICATION AND THE PAYMENT OF A FEE OF FIVE HUNDRED
   24  DOLLARS WHICH MUST ACCOMPANY THE APPLICATION, THE COMMISSION  MAY  GRANT
   25  TO ANY ENTITY HOLDING A LICENSE ISSUED HEREUNDER, THE PRIVILEGE OF HOLD-
   26  ING SUCH A MATCH OR EXHIBITION ON A SPECIFIED DATE IN OTHER PREMISES, OR
   27  IN  ANOTHER  LOCATION, THAN THE PREMISES OF LOCATION PREVIOUSLY APPROVED
   28  BY THE COMMISSION, SUBJECT HOWEVER TO APPROVAL OF THE COMMISSION AND THE
   29  RULES AND REGULATIONS OF THE COMMISSION.
   30    (D) ALL PENALTIES IMPOSED AND COLLECTED BY  THE  COMMISSION  FROM  ANY

   34  BY THEM INTO THE STATE TREASURY.
   35    6. TEMPORARY WORKING PERMITS FOR PROFESSIONAL COMBATIVE SPORTS PARTIC-
   36  IPANTS,  MANAGERS,  TRAINERS AND CHIEF SECONDS. THE COMMISSION MAY ISSUE
   37  TEMPORARY WORKING PERMITS TO PROFESSIONAL COMBATIVE SPORTS PARTICIPANTS,
   38  THEIR MANAGERS, TRAINERS AND CHIEF SECONDS. A TEMPORARY  WORKING  PERMIT
   39  SHALL AUTHORIZE THE EMPLOYMENT OF THE HOLDER OF SUCH PERMIT TO ENGAGE IN
   40  A  SINGLE MATCH OR EXHIBITION AT A SPECIFIED TIME AND PLACE. A TEMPORARY
   41  WORKING PERMIT MAY BE ISSUED IF IN THE JUDGMENT OF  THE  COMMISSION  THE
   42  PARTICIPATION  OF  THE HOLDER THEREOF IN A PROFESSIONAL COMBATIVE SPORTS

   46  REQUIRE  THAT  PROFESSIONAL  COMBATIVE  SPORTS PARTICIPANTS APPLYING FOR

   51    7.  LICENSE  FEES;  TERM  OF  LICENSES; RENEWALS. EACH APPLICANT FOR A
   52  PROMOTER LICENSE SHALL, BEFORE A LICENSE IS ISSUED  BY  THE  COMMISSION,
   53  PAY  TO  THE  COMMISSION,  AN  ANNUAL LICENSE FEE AS FOLLOWS:  WHERE THE
   54  SEATING CAPACITY IS NOT  MORE  THAN  TWO  THOUSAND  FIVE  HUNDRED,  FIVE
   55  HUNDRED  DOLLARS;  WHERE  THE SEATING CAPACITY IS MORE THAN TWO THOUSAND
   56  FIVE HUNDRED BUT NOT MORE THAN  FIVE  THOUSAND,  ONE  THOUSAND  DOLLARS;

       S. 1707                             6

    1  WHERE  THE SEATING CAPACITY IS MORE THAN FIVE THOUSAND BUT NOT MORE THAN
    2  FIFTEEN THOUSAND, ONE THOUSAND FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS; WHERE  THE  SEATING
    3  CAPACITY  IS  MORE  THAN  FIFTEEN THOUSAND BUT NOT MORE THAN TWENTY-FIVE

   21    8. APPLICATION FOR LICENSE; FINGERPRINTS. (A) EVERY APPLICATION FOR  A
   22  LICENSE SHALL BE IN WRITING, SHALL BE ADDRESSED TO THE COMMISSION, SHALL
   23  BE  SUBSCRIBED  BY  THE APPLICANT, AND AFFIRMED BY HIM AS TRUE UNDER THE
